DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the most effective treatment for patients who underwent a Roux-en-Y gastric bypass and developed postoperatively a vitamin B12 deficiency.
DOC.brief_title: Vitamin Deficiencies and Suppletion in Morbid Obesity
DOC.detailed_description: Vitamin B12 deficiency accounts up to 23-64% bariatric surgery. The investigators purpose is to evaluate the most effective treatment for vitamin B12 deficiency in patients who underwent a Roux-en-Y gastric bypass. Daily oral use of vitamin B12 tablets are may be as effective as vitamin B12 injections.
DOC.criteria: Vitamin B12 deficiency: <200 pmol/l Vitamin B12 deficiency 612 months after surgery All patients underwent a RouxenY gastric bypass 1. Creatin >150micromol/L 2. Liver enzymes >2 times upper limit 3. Other bariatric operations 4. Intercurrent diseases 5. Gastrointestinal diseases 6. Psychiatric disease 7. Medicines which influences bone density 8. Pregnancy
